docs.snippet: Nori Aoki hit a two-run triple, helping the host Kansas City Royals keep the lead for the second American League wild-card spot by beating the Detroit Tigers, 5-2....
docs.lead_paragraph: Nori Aoki hit a two-run triple, helping the host Kansas City Royals keep the lead for the second American League wild-card spot by beating the Detroit Tigers, 5-2.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; New York Mets defeat Atlanta Braves, 10-2, knocking them out of playoff race; other MLB scores noted.

headline.main: Royals Top Tigers to Maintain Lead for Second A.L. Wild-Card Spot
headline.print_headline: Led by deGrom, Mets Usher Atlanta to Playoff Elimination

docs.snippet: Derek Jeter became the oldest Yankee to record four straight multihit games, Brian McCann homered twice, and Masahiro Tanaka, playing for the first time since July 8, threw 70 pitches....

docs.abstract: New York Yankees salute departing stars with days in their honor, sometimes on two or three occasions years apart; in 2014, Yankees celebrated Derek Jeter Day, and put aside afternoons to honor Paul O'Neil, Joe Torre, Goose Gossage and Tino Martinez, all who received Monument Park plaques.

headline.main: For Yankees, Farewell May Not Mean Goodbye

docs.snippet: Cuba's unprecedented effort to stop a devastating baseball talent drain doesn't seem to be working, with a string of stars leaving for the major leagues in the year since the government allowed a small number to play professionally overseas....

docs.snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio took a quick trip to Pittsburgh with his press secretary, Phil Walzak, that included baseball, beer and a performance by a Johnny Cash cover band....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio took a quick trip to Pittsburgh with his press secretary, Phil Walzak, that included baseball, beer and a performance by a Johnny Cash cover band.
docs.abstract: New York Mayor Bill de Blasio takes impromptu trip to Pittsburgh with his press secretary, Phil Walzak, that included baseball, beer and a performance by a Johnny Cash cover band; for de Blasio, trip is rare chance to escape the pressures of work and family life and it offers bonding time with Walzak, who besides his official duties wrangling reporters has emerged as a close confidant.

headline.main: De Blasio Turns Slow Day Into Adventure
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Turns Slow Day Into Adventure
